title: Product of Cosines
text: Use the formula for the product of cosines to write the product as a sum or difference. The formula is cos(a)cos(b)=1/2[cos(a-b)+cos(a+b)].

title: Substitute Angles
text: To rewrite the product, substitute the given values for the unknown variable angles into the formula.

title: Identifying Unknown Angle a
text: From the formula written as cos(a)cos(b), what is the angle a?

title: Identifying Unknown Angle $$b$$
text: From the formula written as cos(a)cos(b), what is the angle $$b$$?

title: Plugging in Angles
text: Use the formula and plug in the identified values for the angles a and $$b$$. Leave the $$\frac{1}{2}$$ as a constant multiplier for the sum of cosines.

title: Cosine Even-Odd Identitiy
text: Recall that we can rewrite $$cos(-x)$$ as cos(x) equivalently.
